description: Advanced study of re DNA techniques; bioreactor design for bacteria, mammalian and insect culture; separation methods; chromatography; drug and cell delivery systems; gene therapy; and diagnostics.
name: ENGINEERING BIOTEC

values.comments:
This course is an advanced study of re DNA techniques; bioreactor design for
bacteria, mammalian and insect culture; separation methods; chromatography; drug and
cell delivery systems; gene therapy; and diagnostics.
Students described this course as “excellent” and “interesting”. However, they
seemed overwhelmed by the amount of material covered in each class and found the
textbook useless. One student suggested that the class would be better as two 1.5 hour
classes instead of one 3 hour class per week. A large aspect of the class that was
generally disliked was the group-work, which was seen as a burden.
The professor's teaching ability was above standards, and, according to one
student, “his knowledge base is awe-inspiring.” However, it was the general consensus
that “the lectures [were] difficult to follow as the material [was] gone through incredibly
quickly.”
Overall, the emphasis on mathematics suggests that this class is directed primarily
towards engineering students. This is a must-take course for majors interested in modern
day biotechnology.
